title: Network Basics
description: Core Linux networking inspection, connectivity, and DNS lookup commands.

cards.prompt: Using Linux networking tools, show all network interfaces and addresses.
cards.explanation: ip addr show displays interface status and assigned addresses.

cards.prompt: Using Linux networking tools, show interfaces in brief format.
cards.explanation: -br prints concise output for quick checks.

cards.prompt: Using Linux networking tools, print the current routing table.
cards.explanation: ip route shows default route and subnet routes.

cards.prompt: Using Linux networking tools, show which route would be used to reach 8.8.8.8.
cards.explanation: route get reveals selected interface and source address.

cards.prompt: Using Linux networking tools, list listening TCP and UDP ports numerically.
Using Linux networking tools, show all TCP sockets with process info.
cards.explanation: -a all sockets, -t TCP only, -p includes process info.

cards.prompt: Using Linux networking tools, send exactly 4 ICMP pings to example.com.
cards.explanation: -c controls how many packets to send.

cards.prompt: Using Linux networking tools, ping 1.1.1.1 every 0.2 seconds for 5 packets.
cards.explanation: -i sets interval and -c sets total packets.

cards.prompt: Using Linux networking tools, trace the network path to example.com.
cards.explanation: traceroute shows packet hops to destination.

cards.prompt: Using Linux networking tools, query A records for example.com with short output.
Using Linux networking tools, resolve DNS for api.example.com.
cards.explanation: nslookup performs a direct DNS query.

cards.prompt: Using Linux networking tools, query MX records for example.com.
cards.explanation: -t selects DNS record type to query.
